dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDEE
dialogues.text: No, stabbing!

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDUM
dialogues.text: Thrusting like this! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 64 65 66 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 54.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pokes him. Dee pokes him back. They go at it as the Dormouse and Alice fight. Alice steps...back...and back. pass the Queen’s dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hatter tries hats on the Queen with aloof disdain. Sh looks in her MIRRORS which are distorted to make her head appear normal-sized. She preens. Hatter looks up to see A losing in swordplay to the Dormouse. In a moment, the battling Tweedles pass by as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mallymkun stands on a bureau with Alice up against the wa Alice ducks as the sword swishes over her head. Alice see her moment and slices the thin rope at Mally’s waist whic holds the eye. It drops into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Hal She runs with it. Mallymkun doesn’t give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mallymkun shakes her head at the Hatter as if to say Alic a hopeless case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice approaches the Bandersnatch. He growls.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I have your eye. She holds it up. Seeing his lost eye, the Bandersnatch whines. Alice slowly lifts the bar to open the stall door and eases inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the eye up. He growls. She puts it on the groun near him. He sniffs it, whines, and pulls it closer with paws. While he’s distracted, Alice goes to the back of the stal She sees a chest covered by a tarp. She removes the tarp reveal an ornate metal chest secured with a large lock. Disheartened and feverish, Alice slumps to the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 69 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pulls her sleeve back to look at the swollen, infecte wound on her arm. She touches it, stifles a cry of pain. She glances at the Bandersnatch, still busy with his eye. Sweating and shivering, she pulls at the lock. But her vision goes dim. She blinks, shaking her head. And the world goes black. INT. THE HALL —- MORNING 67 BIG NOSE WOMAN and BIG BELLY MAN walk silently to the Que dressing room. They fidget as if they’re very uncomfortab INT. QUEEN’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 68 Once inside, they smile, gasp and flatter.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BELLY MAN
dialogues.text: You are stunning in that hat! The Hatter takes it off and dumps a large brimmed hat on that covers half her face.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NOSE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Your Majesty has never looked better. Her NOSE falls off and lands on the Queen’s shoulder. The Hatter picks it up curiously.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: It smells like you’ve dropped something. The woman feels for her nose which is still there but nor sized. She gasps, grabs the fake and turns away quickly. The Hatter’s eyes narrow suspiciously. He can see straps above BIG BELLY MAN’S pants which hold his protruding bel in place. The woman turns back with her long nose reattached. Hatter laughs out loud, not a mad laugh but w genuine amusement. They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Never mind him. He’s mad. Lady Long-Ears rushes in and whispers into the Queen’s ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice wakes up. The Bandersnatch looms over her. He's managed to shove the eye back into its socket. It stares upwards uselessly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 71 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 56.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But he seems to feel better for having it back in place. notices a large key on a chain hung around his neck. The to the lock. She reaches for it. The Bandersnatch sniffs her arm and the wound he inflicted. She winces but will n be deterred. She pulls the key off. The Bandersnatch gently licks the wound. His tongue is soothing. She sighs and allows him to lick the wound clea She looks at it. Miraculously, the infection is gone and swelling is down. She moves it around. No pain. The Bandersnatch looks at her, one eye askew.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I suppose you think this makes us even now. Alice fits the key into the lock on the chest and opens i She lifts the Vorpal Sword. It’s made of shining silver w an ornate handle. She holds it up to the light. There are runes engraved on the blade. She carries it out of the stall, glancing back at the Bandersnatch before going out INT. RED QUEEN’S GREAT HALL - DAY 70 The Knave is on his knees before the Queen, talking fast.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Um forced herself on me. I told her my heart belongs to you. But she’s obsessed with me. The Queen goes bright red with rage.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Off with her head! INT. RED QUEEN’S DRESSING ROOM - DAY 71 The Dormouse tries to pick the lock to the chain around Hatter’s ankle with her hatpin.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stand back, Mallymkun. The Dormouse and the Hatter look up to see Alice victorio holding the Vorpal Sword high over her head.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: How’s this for “muchness”? She brings the sword toward the chain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 57.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Stop! It mustn’t be used for anything but... Stayne strides in with his Knights. He points to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Arrest that girl for unlawful seduction.

dialogues.speaker: THE DORMOUSE
dialogues.text: Hatter! She tosses the Hatter the decorative sword from the hall. fights with Stayne. Hatter is formidable even chained. Ma stabs the Knights with her hatpin. Alice swings the Sword

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: No! Take it to the White Queen!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving without you!

dialogues.speaker: THE DORMOUSE
dialogues.text: Alice! Go! Stayne stops dead. He looks at her with sudden revelation

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Alice?

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: She runs.

dialogues.speaker: SEIZE HER
dialogues.text: EXT. THE RED QUEEN’S CASTLE - DAY 72 She bursts out the back. Stayne and the Knights just behi She runs, dodging Knights. But they manage to surround he She swings the sword to keep them back.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Alice. Of course! Why didn’t I see it? Well, it has been a long time. And you were such a little tyke then. Give me the Sword. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 74 75 76 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 58.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Stay back! He distracts her as two Knights come up behind.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: The Queen will be so pleased. She’ll take great pleasure in taking off your head. I believe she wants to do the deed herself. As the Knights grab her there’s a deep THUNDEROUS GROWL. Bandersnatch runs at them, biting and snapping. They rele Alice and back away. The Bandersnatch lowers his head for to climb onto his back. Stayne and the Knights astonished

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Downal wyth Bluddy Behg Hid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and the Bandersnatch approach the open drawbridge. Knights abandon their post. They pound across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bayard waits on nearby hill. He sees the Bandersnatch wit Alice on its back. He runs out to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODHOUND
dialogues.text: Ho, Alice!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Bayard! To Marmoreal! EXT. WHITE QUEEN’S CASTLE - DAY 75 Bayard leads Alice and the Bandersnatch toward the White Queen’s Castle. The drawbridge lowers for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Queen’s castle is light and airy in contrast to oppression of her sister’s. She sits on her throne. The W KNIGHT'S suit of armor stands in a prominent position. Al enters carrying the Vorpal Sword.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Welcome to Marmoreal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alice bows and offers her the Vorpal sword. The White Que nods her thanks. She places the Sword in the hand of the standing suit of silver armor.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: The Vorpal Sword is home again. The armor is complete. Now all we need is a champion. She looks at Alice significantly. Alice drops her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: You're a little taller than I thought you'd be.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Blame it on too much Upelkuchen.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Come with me. INT. THE WHITE QUEEN’S KITCHEN - DAY - LATER 77 As they enter, a pepper mill flies across the room and hi the wall behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Is the March Hare around?

dialogues.speaker: MARCH HARE
dialogues.text: You’re late for soup! He picks up a whole pot of soup and throws it. It hits th wall. Alice takes a finger to the wall for a taste.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Could use salt. A salt shaker comes flying at her. She catches it and “sa the wall. She tastes it again and kisses her fingers in a gesture of perfection. The White Queen prepares Pishalver in a pot on the stove, taking ingredients from a cupboard filled with an admixtu of herbs, spices, flour, sugar, insects, shriveled finger eyeballs, and other odious things.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Pishalver. Let me think. Two cups grape juice,, a pinch of wormfat... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 60. 77 WHITE QUEEN (cont'd) My mother taught me how to concoct all the medicinal cures and transformational potions, a teaspoon vanilla...urine of the horsefly, buttered fingers... ...-My sister preferred to study Dominion Over Living Things. Tell me, how does she seem to you?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Perfectly horrid.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: She wasn’t always that way. Well, Maybe she was. And her head?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Bulbous, bloated, like a blimp.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: I think she may have some kind of growth in there...something pressing on her brain. ...three coins from a dead man’s pocket, two tablespoons of Wishful Thinking...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You can’t imagine the things that go on in that place.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I can. But when a champion steps forth to slay the Jabberwocky, the people will rise against her. (she spits into it) That should do it. She dips a tiny spoon into the pot and offers it to Alice

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blow. Alice blows, takes a sip and shrinks to her normal size.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Feel better?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Much. Thank you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 79 80 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 61.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: There’s someone here who would like to speak with you. INT. THE RED QUEEN’S GREAT HALL/THRONE ROOM - DAY 78

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Majesty, Alice has escaped. The Queen is so angry she slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: On the Bandersnatch. She slaps him again.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: With the Vorpal Sword. She slaps him yet again. He grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: How could you let this happen?

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: I may have underestimated her. But we have her conspirators. The Hatter and a Dormouse.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Off with their heads! INT. THE RED QUEEN’S DUNGEON - NIGHT 79 A FEMALE BLOODHOUND, BIELLE, paces her cell as her pups shiver in the corner. INT. THE RED QUEEN’S DUNGEON/HATTER’S CELL - NIGHT 80 Hatter’s slumped on the floor, staring off into space, Mallymkun’s in a large bird cage hung from the ceiling. Stayne arrives with his Red Knights.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Hatter! No response. A Knight prods him with his truncheon.

dialogues.speaker: A KNIGHT
dialogues.text: He’s ‘round the bend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 62.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Pity. It’s a bore to behead a madman. No weeping, no begging...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE BLOODHOUND
dialogues.text: Why are you keeping us here? We've done nothing wrong!

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Blame your husband. He left you here to rot.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE BLOODHOUND
dialogues.text: You lie! She leaps at the bars snarling. He jumps back. The Hatter instantly has his arm around Stayne’s neck, squeezing. Hi men try to break the Hatter’s grip. But the madness is in eyes and he feels no pain. Finally, the Knights free Stay He staggers back, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Your head comes off at dawn! And that one too! He points to the Dormouse. The Hatter turns conciliatory.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Oh, come come. It’s such a small insignificant little head. Hardly seems worth the effort. Why don’t you let her go? I‘’1l give you an entertaining execution. I’1l beg. I'1l grovel. Weep, etcetera. But Mallymkun’s not about to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: THE DORMOUSE
dialogues.text: Down with Bloody Big Head! She throws her hatpin sword at the Knave. It sticks into shoulder. He gasps and pulls it out, then forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Have a pleasant night. EXT. THE WHITE QUEEN’S TOPIARY GARDEN - NIGHT 81 Alice sees a tell-tale plume of smoke coming from a topia mushroom.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Absolem? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 63.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I thought we’d settled this. I’m Alice...but not that one.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: How do you know? He blows smoke in her face. She coughs and waves it away.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You said so yourself.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: I said you were Not Hardly Alice. But you’re much more her now. In fact, you're Almost Alice.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Even so, I couldn’t slay the Jabberwocky if my life depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: It will. So I suggest you keep the Vorpal Sword on hand when the Frabjous Day arrives. She abruptly pokes him with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: No touching! There’s no touching!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You seem so real. Sometimes, I forget that this is all a dream. He blows smoke at her again.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Stop doing that! He chuckles and his whole body jiggles like green jelly. keeps chuckling as he obliterates himself from view. 82 INT. THE RED QUEEN’S DUNGEON - NIGHT 82 The Hatter cleans his hat and tries to get his “sad” clot to perk up. The Cheshire Cat appears outside the bars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 84 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 64.

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: I've always admired that hat.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Hello, Chess.

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: Since you won't be needing it any more, would you consider bequeathing it to me?

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: It’s a formal execution. I want to look my best.

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: It’s a pity about all this. I was looking forward to seeing you Futterwacken.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: I was rather good at it. The Cat re-materializes in the cell with the Hatter. CHESHIRE CAT (CONT’D) I really do love that hat. I would wear it to all the finest occasions. EXT. THE RED QUEEN’S COURTYARD - DAWN 83 The Hatter and the Dormouse walk toward the executioner w their heads down. The Tweedles and the White Rabbit blend with the crowd. The Queen and Stayne watch from a balcony

dialogues.speaker: THE BEHEADING PLATFORM 84
dialogues.text: The Hatter and Dormouse stand on the platform. The Hatter steps forward, pushing Dormouse behind him. The Execution attempts to take off his hat. He mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: THE HATTER
dialogues.text: I want to keep it on.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIONER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. As long as I can get at your neck. The Hatter places his neck on the beheading stone.

dialogues.speaker: THE DORMOUSE
dialogues.text: I'll be right behind you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The White Rabbit covers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE RABBIT
dialogues.text: I can’t watch. The Executioner raises his sword. All is quiet. The sword comes down. But the accused’s body disappears. The Queen Stayne gasp. The sword hits the stone, jarring the executioner. The Tweedles stare in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDEE
dialogues.text: It’s gone. The Rabbit still hasn’t looked.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE RABBIT
dialogues.text: He was such a fine fellow.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDUM
dialogues.text: Look! The Rabbit looks up to see the floating head with no body attached.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIONER
dialogues.text: I can’t behead nobody if there’s no body! The Cheshire Cat’s disembodied head wearing the Hat float upright and hovers in the air. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: THE DORMOUSE
dialogues.text: Chess, you dog! He winks at her. They hear the HATTER’S TELL-TALE LAUGH. He’s standing on a balustrade.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Majesty, your courtiers are playing you for a fool! He tugs on Lady Long Ear’s ear. It comes off in his hand. Long Ears screams. The Hatter holds the long dangling ear up.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: LADY LONG EARS
dialogues.text: I’m not the only one, Majesty. Look! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 86 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She grabs Big Nose Woman’s nose and pulls. It comes off revealing her real nose beneath.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BELLY MAN
dialogues.text: A counterfeit nose! You should be ashamed!

dialogues.speaker: BIG NOSE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Me? What about that big belly you’re so proud of? She pulls up his shirt to reveal his fake belly.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Liars! Cheats! Falsifiers! Off with their heads!

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: To the abused and enslaved of the Red Queen’s court, stand up and fight! Downal wyth Bluddy Behg Hid! A FROG holding a tray of tarts tosses them into the air. Other animals throw off their bonds and take up the sloga

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS ANIMALS
dialogues.text: Downal wyth Bluddy Behg Hid!

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Loose the JUBJUB BIRD! There’s a bloodcurdling SCREECH as the JubJub Bird swoops down. He strafes the panicked onlookers indiscriminately. The Queen watches with a vengeful smile.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: You're right, Stayne. It is far better to be feared than loved. Prepare the Jabberwocky for battle. We're going to visit my little sister.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HATTER ET AL. 85
dialogues.text: The Hatter, the Dormouse, the White Rabbit, the March Har and Tweedles gather to escape. INT. THE WHITE QUEEN’S CASTLE - PARAPET - EVENING 86 The White Queen, Alice and Bayard stand on the castle wal

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: I had hoped to have a champion by now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 87 88 89 90 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 67.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you slay the Jabberwocky yourself? You must have the power.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: In the healing arts. It is against my vows to bring harm to any living thing. She glances down to see an UGLY bug near her shoe. She shudders and secretly squashes it. Then, she lifts the sp glass and sees something in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: We have company. She gives the spyglass to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BLUFFS 87
dialogues.text: The Hatter, the Dormouse, the White Rabbit, and Tweedles appear over the rise. THE WHITE QUEEN’S PARAPET 88 Alice hands the spyglass to Bayard.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Bayard. Have a look. He looks through.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUP
dialogues.text: His wife and pups run with the others. He’s overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLOODHOUND
dialogues.text: Bielle. EXT. WHITE QUEEN’S CASTLE - COURTYARD - LATER 90 The group enters the castle. Bayard, Bielle and their pup leap, whine and nuzzle each other joyfully. Alice runs to greet the Hatter. His clothes are “bright” and happy.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I’m so happy to see you! I thought they were going to...

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: (manic/enthusiastic) So did I. But they didn’t. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 68.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MAD HATTER (cont'd) Here I am...still in one piece...and I’m rather glad about that now that I’m seeing you again...I would have regretted not seeing you again...especially now that you’re the proper size...it’s a good size...just right, in fact...a right proper Alice size...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Hatter. He jerks and comes back to himself.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Where’s your hat? The Hat materializes in the air worn by the Cheshire Cat. ALICE (CONT’D) Chessur?

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: How's the arm, luv?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: All healed. The Hatter holds out his hand for the Hat. Chess returns reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: Good-bye, sweet Hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hatter sits with Alice on top of a high tower.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Why is a raven like a writing desk?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: A riddle! This will be fun. Let me think about it.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: You do know what tomorrow is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 69.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: The Frabjous day. How could I forget? Oh, I wish I’d wake up!

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: You still think this is a dream?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Well, it can’t possibly be real. This has all come from my own mind.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Which would mean that I’m not real.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry to say. You're just a figment of my imagination. I would dream up someone who’s half-mad.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: But you’d have to be half-mad to dream me up.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I must be then. They lean against each other, secure in the comfort of th own mutual madness.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I give up. Why is a raven like a writing desk?

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: I haven't the slightest idea.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (amused) I‘1l miss you when I wake up. 92 INT. THE WHITE QUEEN’S COURTYARD - DAWN - THE FRABJOUS The White Rabbit blows his trumpet.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE RABBIT
dialogues.text: Who will step forth to be champion for the White Queen? The Hatter steps forward valiantly.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: That would be I! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 70.

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: You have very poor evaporating skills. I should be the one.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDUM
dialogues.text: No, me! Dee pushes Dum behind him.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDEE
dialogues.text: No, me! The White Rabbit holds up the Oraculum and the illustrati of Alice slaying the Jabberwocky. Everyone falls quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDUM
dialogues.text: No other slayer, nohow.

dialogues.speaker: TWEEDLEDEE
dialogues.text: If it ain’t Alice, he ain’t dead. All eyes turn to Alice. The feeling is not unlike the pressure of that moment under the gazebo.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Alice, you cannot live your life to please others. The choice must be yours because when you step out to face that creature, you will step out alone. Overwhelmed, she runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice falls onto a garden bench and weeps.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: Nothing was ever accomplished with tears.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Absolem?

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: On the leaf. He’s hanging upside down on a leaf, spinning a chrysalis.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Why are you upside down? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 71.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: I’ve come to the end of this life.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You're going to die?

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: Transform. The chrysalis begins to cover his body.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Don’t go. I need your help. I don’t know what to do!

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: I can’t help you if you don’t even know who you are, stupid girl.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I’m not stupid! My name is Alice. I live in London. I have a mother named Helen and a sister named Margaret. My father was Charles Kingsley. He had a vision that stretched half-way around the world and nothing ever stopped him. He would have liked it here. (with revelation) I'm his daughter. I’m Alice Kingsley.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: Alice At Last! You were just as dim- witted the first time you were here. You called it Wonderland as I recall... The name stirs a distant memory.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Wonderland. INT./EXT. ALICE’S DREAM 94 Her dream comes flooding back. She's Young Alice in Wonderland; Young Alice in the Room of Doors; Young Alice with the Cheshire Cat; Young Alice at the Mad Tea party; Young Alice with the Red Queen and Playing Cards painting roses red, Young Alice with the Caterpillar.  95 96 97 98 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALICE (CONT’D) It wasn’t a dream at all. It was a memory! This place is real! And so are you. And so is the Hatter. Her heart leaps at that last thought.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATERPILLAR
dialogues.text: And the Jabberwocky. Remember, the Vorpal Sword knows what it wants. All you have to do is hold on to it. Fairfarren, Alice. Perhaps, I will see you in another life. He disappears inside the green chrysalis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Queen rides a black steed, Ilosovic Stayne at her side. Behind them, the Red Queen’s Army marches steadily across the red desert. The JubJub flies ahead. A monstrou winged shadow soars above. EXT. THE WHITE QUEEN’S CASTLE - CONT. 97 Everyone has gathered just outside the castle walls. They wait nervously for Alice to make her decision. The Bandersnatch lopes out, a White Knight astride him, h blonde hair hangs down the back of the shining armour. Sh holds the Vorpal sword high. A rousing cheer rises up. Bu the cheer fades as they feel a shadow pass overhead.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH HARE
dialogues.text: It’s coming! Look up! But Alice is undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: To the Tulgey Wood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Queen and her allies meet the Red Queen and her army at the same clearing in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Hello, Iracebeth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 73.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Mirana. The White Rabbit blows his trumpet.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE RABBIT
dialogues.text: On this the Frabjous Day, the Queens, Red and White shall send forth their champions to do battle on their behalf.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh ‘Racie... The Red Queen’s eyes soften to hear her childhood nick-na

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: We don’t have to fight. The Red Queen’s eyes narrow suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know what you’re doing. You think you can blink those pretty little eyes and I’11 melt like Mums and Daddy did.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Just give me my Crown.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s my crown! I’m the eldest!

dialogues.speaker: JABBERWOCKY
dialogues.text: Behind her, a dark form rises. The March Hare twitches uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: MARCH HARE
dialogues.text: Look up! It’s here! Look up! Jabberwocky’s vast wingspan darkens the clearing. It swin its reptilian head, whips its pronged tail, extends one deadly claw and adjusts it’s vest. Alice can barely contain her fear.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: But this is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Only if you believe it is. His words spark a memory of her father. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 99 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 74.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: “Sometimes I believe as many as six impossible things before breakfast”.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: An excellent practice, but just at the moment, you should focus on the Jabberwocky. The right answer. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Where’s your champion, little sister? Alice steps boldly into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE AND THE JABBERWOCKY 99
dialogues.text: She looks up at the huge terrifying creature. The Jabberwocky roars. Alice whispers to herself, her voice trembling.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Six impossible things. Count them, Alice. One! There’s a potion that can make you shrink. Two! And a cake that can make you grow. She draws the Vorpal Sword. The Jabberwocky lowers its hu head and hisses.

dialogues.speaker: JABBERWOCKY
dialogues.text: So my old foe, we meet on the battlefield once again. Alice is shocked. She hadn’t thought that it could talk.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: We have never met.

dialogues.speaker: JABBERWOCKY
dialogues.text: Not you, insignificant bearer. My ancient enemy, the Vorpal one. He strikes out suddenly with his spiked tongue. Alice lif the Sword to defend herself and the Sword slices off the Jabberwocky’s tongue. It falls to the ground wriggling in the dirt. The Jabberwocky can only make a burbling sound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 75.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: That’s enough chatter. The Jabberwocky whips its pronged tail and knocks her to ground. She lays for a moment, catching her breath and continuing her six impossible things. ALICE (CONT’D) Three. Animals can talk. The Jabberwocky drives its spike tail down to stab her. S barely rolls out of its way in time. ALICE (CONT’D) (faltering) Four. Four, Alice! She pulls herself to her feet. ALICE (CONT’D) Cats can disappear.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Watch your head! She ducks in time to avoid the creature’s snapping jaws.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Five. There is a place called Wonderland. It swipes at her with long curved claws. She deflects the

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six. She stands still for a moment, then slowly lifts her head All fear is gone. There is nothing but fierce intention a bloodlust in her eye. ALICE (CONT’D) And I can slay the Jabberwocky! She swings the Sword and attacks with fury. The Jabberwoc is surprised by her fierceness. They do battle.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Behind you! She turns, distracted. CLAWS scrape down the back of her armor. Alice backs up toward the Hatter, fending off the Jabberwocky. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 101 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 76.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALICE (CONT’D) I can manage. Thank you. The Red Queen sees them talking.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: The Hatter’s interfering! Off with his head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stayne runs toward him, sword drawn. The Hatter fights ba and the well-ordered duel erupts into a full-scale battle with Alice and the Jabberwocky in the eye of the storm. During the battle... .--Bayard and Mallymkun take on the JubJub bird... ...-Chess disappears and reappears to confuse the Red Knights... ...the Bandersnatch does battle with four Red Knights... ...the Tweedles fight back-to-back with perfect precision timing and not a single argument... ..-March Hare stares upward, paralyzed with fear until he gets slammed by a Red Knight. Then he goes crazy, throwin things like a wild man.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE AND THE JABBERWOCKY 101
dialogues.text: Alice leaps onto the Jabberwocky, pulling herself up his scales. He twists and snaps trying to shake her off. The Vorpal Sword practically pulls itself out of her hand in relentless pursuit of the creature’s head. Alice makes he way to the Jabberwocky’s vest where she clings trying to slash its neck with the sword. The vest buttons strain with Alice’s weight. They snap...one...two...three...only one left holding the vest by a thread. Alice can barely hold onto the slashing Swor Just as the last button gives way, she propels herself in the air.

dialogues.speaker: OFF WITH YOUR HEAD
dialogues.text: With one powerful thrust, she cuts off the Jabberwocky’s head. Both Alice and the head fall at once, the Jabberwocky’s jaws still snapping at her in its death thr (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alice hits the ground hard. The Jabberwocky’s head rolls few feet away. She lays on the ground, breathing heavily. Finally, she picks up the Jabberwocky’s head, carries it the Red Queen and drops it at her feet. The Queen points Alice imperiously.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: Kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nearest Red Knight throws down his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: RED KNIGHT
dialogues.text: We follow you no more...bloody big head.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: How dare you! Off with his head! The other Red Knights toss their weapons down. The crown lifts off the Red Queen’s head. She snatches for it as it floats over to the White Queen where it gently lowers to head. The Cheshire Cat materializes next to her.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Iracebeth of Crims, your crimes against Underland are worthy of death. But that is against my vows. Therefore, you are banished to the Outlands. No one is to show you any kindness or ever speak a word to you. You will have not a friend in the world. Stayne bows unctuously to the White Queen.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Majesty I hope you bear me no ill will.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: Except this one. TIlosovic Stayne you will join Iracebeth in banishment from this day until the end of Underland. The White Knights grab Stayne and chain him to Iracebeth.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: At least, we have each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In a last panic, Stayne pulls a knife and tries to stab h She screams. The Hatter knocks the knife away. Stayne dro to his knees before the White Queen.

dialogues.speaker: KNAVE OF HEARTS
dialogues.text: Kill me...please.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: But I do not owe you a kindness. Red and White Knights drag them away.

dialogues.speaker: RED QUEEN
dialogues.text: You tried to kill me! YOU TRIED TO

dialogues.speaker: KILL ME
dialogues.text: The Hatter bursts into an enthusiastic dance.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Oh Frabjous Day! Callou! Callay!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: CHESHIRE CAT
dialogues.text: Futterwacken. The Hatter pulls Alice into the dance. It’s a wild, wacky joyous dance and when it’s done...he kisses her, at last. Chess puts a comforting arm around a disappointed Mallymk The White Queen leans down to the still bleeding Jabberwocky’s neck to catch a drop of its blood into a vi

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: And blood of the Jabberwocky. You have our everlasting gratitude. And for your efforts on our behalf... The Queen hands the vial to her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Will this take me home?

dialogues.speaker: WHITE QUEEN
dialogues.text: If that is what you choose. Alice lifts the vial. The Hatter puts his hand on hers.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: You could stay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 103 104 105 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 79.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: What an idea... a crazy, mad wonderful idea. She looks at the strange and wonderful beings she’s met i this strange and wonderful place. But then, thoughts of h mother and sister and unfinished business intrude. ALICE (CONT’D) But I cannot. There are questions I have to answer. And things I still must do. She drinks the potion. ALICE (CONT’D) I'll be back again before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: You won’t remember me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Of course I will! How could I forget? His face starts to shimmer as he whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MAD HATTER
dialogues.text: Fairfarren, Alice. Underland shimmers and then dissolves into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grass. Alice finds herself face down in the field, clingi to the edge of the Rabbit hole, legs dangling precariousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice pulls herself up and looks around, blinking in the bright sun. She shakes her head. All memory of Underland once again. She looks down at her clothes, confused by th ragged, torn, filthy condition. She looks at the rabbit h

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: -.-must have fallen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is still going on although a bit subdued. Hamis speaks to the confused guests. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 80.

dialogues.speaker: HAMISH
dialogues.text: She left me standing there without an answer.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: A case of nerves, no doubt. People fall silent as Alice wanders back onto the lawn, looking like she’s been through a war.

dialogues.speaker: HAMISH
dialogues.text: Alice?

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASCOT
dialogues.text: Good Lord. Are you all right? Her mother goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I fell down a hole and hit my head.

dialogues.speaker: LADY ASCOT
dialogues.text: You look a frightful mess. Alice turns to Hamish. Her adventure, although unremember has given Alice unwavering confidence and self-awareness.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Hamish, I can’t marry you. You're not the right man for me. And there’s that trouble with your digestion. (to her sister) I love you, Margaret. But this is my life. I’11 decide what to do with it. (to Lowell) You're lucky to have my sister for your wife, Lowell. I know you'll be good to her. I'’11 be watching, very closely. He blanches at the veiled threat. She turns to Imogene. ALICE (CONT’D) There is no prince, Aunt Imogene. You need to talk to someone about these delusions. She addresses Lady Ascot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 106 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALICE (CONT’D) I happen to love rabbits, especially white ones. She turns to her mother and kisses her on the cheek. ALICE (CONT’D) Don’t worry, Mother. I'’11 find something useful to do with my life. (to the Chattaways) You two remind me of some funny boys I met in a dream. She looks around. Anyone else? Lord Ascot lifts a finger.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASCOT
dialogues.text: You've left me out.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: No I haven’t, sir. You and I have business to discuss.

dialogues.speaker: LADY ASCOT
dialogues.text: The impertinence!

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASCOT
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear what she has to say. Shall we speak in the study? He starts to lead her off, but she turns back.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Oh, and one more thing. She lifts her skirt, revealing her bare legs and does a b Futterwacken to the shock of some and delight of others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice studies a map of the world on the table.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: My father told me he planned to expand his trade route to Sumatra and Borneo. But I don’t think he was looking far enough.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASCOT
dialogues.text: Not far enough? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 107 10/28/08 Blue Revised Pages 82.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Why not go all the way to China? It’s vast, the culture is rich and we have a foothold in Hong Kong. To be the first to trade with China. Can you imagine it? She looks at him. Her eyes shine just like her father’s d

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASCOT
dialogues.text: If you were anyone else, I would say you've lost your senses. But I’ve seen that look before. Since you're not going to be my daughter-in-law, perhaps you would consider an apprenticeship with the company? On her surprise and delight we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has gathered to see the China Trading Company’s s off. Alice stands on the deck, waving to her mother, sist and Lord Ascot. As the ship pulls away, a beautiful Monar butterfly with blue tinged wings lands on her shoulder. S smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Hello, Absolem. The butterfly takes wing, as Alice watches it soar skywar
